value.title: AI and Microsoft Power BI: The realm of impossible - THR2038
value.excerpt: There is a huge demand to get more insight from the data using AI and advanced analytics. In this session, learn how to use current visual and custom visual in Power BI to get more insight from your data. Also, learn how to use current embedded AI features in Power BI.

value.title: Be Careful When Merging on Text Fields in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables in Power Query is one of the most useful transformations to combine data from different datasets, and also create a flatten data structure. However, if you use a text field for merge, then you might see some unexpected results. Here in this video, I share some important considerations

value.title: Cartesian Product in Power Query   Multiply All Sets of All Pairs in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sometimes, you need to create a multiplication of all sets of all pairs from two different data tables in Power BI. value.title: CDS and CDM are Not the Same   Difference Explained

value.title: Day of Year and Day of Quarter   DAX calculations for Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has some built-in, easy-to-use DAX functions to get the Day of Month and Day of the week, but nothing for Day of Year and Day of the quarter. These calculations, however, are very simple and easy to implement using other functions. This short blog and video explain a method to calculate those

value.title: Fibonacci Sequence   Understanding the Power Query Recursive Function for Power BI
value.excerpt: Recursive functions in Power Query are not very popular, but sometimes very helpful when in need. In this post, I'll explain what a recursive function is, how it works, and explain it through a famous recursive example of Fibonacci Sequence. value.title: How to modify a linked entity in Power BI dataflows
value.excerpt: It is not possible to change a linked entity in a dataflow in Power BI. Linked entities has to be modified only in the dataflow in which they are created.
